channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NJ

item.title: Report X-2023081105
item.description:
Report X-2023081105

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-14T15:12:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-10
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Upon discovery the package was placed into a salvage drum to contain the spillage. DescribePack: Upon my inspection of the plastic jerrican containing GARDOCLEAN S 5413 5 gallons, there was a small puncture hole that triggered a slow leakage of contents. Of about 2 ounces of leakage. DurationRel: 12 and MitigateEffect: FACILITY PROCEDURES FOR DAMAGED HAZARDOUS MATERIAL FOLLOWED, CONTENTS CONTAINED AND AWAITING DISPOSITION.

item.title: Report E-2023090080
item.description:
Report E-2023090080

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-24
  • City: EAST NEWARK
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 24, 2023, four (4) 90-pound boxes of UN2491 were torn and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior and dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the impacted site. ES personnel utilized hand tools and a neutralizing agent to remediate the site. All spent absorbents and the damaged containers of product were collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon drums to be staged onsite for disposal by R+L.

item.title: Report X-2023080826
item.description:
Report X-2023080826

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-09
  • City: BARRINGTON
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: DURING THE UNLOAD PROCESS, THE MANAGER NOTICED THE PACKAGE WAS WET AND IMMEDIATELY TOOK THE PACKAGE OVER TO THE HAZMAT CAGE TO SECURE AND VENTILATE IT PROPERLY. I WAS THEN CALLED OVER TO HANDLE THE REPACKING PROCESS. DescribePack: THERE WERE FOUR BOTTLES INSIDE THE PACKAGE. ONE OF THOSE FOUR BOTTLES HAD A LOOSE CAP ON IT WHICH THEN CAUSED IT TO LEAK OUT ONTO THE OTHER 3 REMAINING BOTTLES AND ALSO CAUSING THE PACKAGE ITSELF TO BE WET. APPROXIMATELY 2 CUPS OF LIQUID LEAKED OUT OF THAT ONE BOTTLE. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: AFTER THE MANAGER SECURED AND VENTILATED THE PACKAGE I WAS CALLED OVER. I PROCEEDED TO REPACK IT INTO A YELLOW SALVAGE DRUM PROPERLY AND SECURELY. AFTER IT WAS DONE BEING REPACKED I AM WAITING FOR THE DISPOSITION FROM PGH.

item.title: Report X-2023081083
item.description:
Report X-2023081083

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-14T03:11:45+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-31
  • City: WAYNE
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: When Joe Cook (Ops manager) went through his door checks, he discovered a leaking package that turned out to be a hazmat. The spillage was limited to the outer packages. The QA put on proper PPE and contained hazmat in a red hazardous bin. DescribePack: The package did not have visible cracks or punctures in the inner containers. The caps of both of the containers were a bit loose upon evaluation DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Hazmat was stored within a red hazardous materials bin and kept upright upon inspection.
